newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: KL noon rubber firmer on Tokyo's gains.
newsitem.headline: KL noon rubber firmer on Tokyo's gains.

text.p: Rubber prices in Malaysia were firmer at noon session mainly due to Tokyo's gains, but trading was cautious at the start of the week, dealers said.
"Today is Monday and people are cautious," a trader said, adding that prices moved up on some local dealers' covering and gains in Tokyo.

Dealers said some market players were still concerned about the Thai government's decision to default on taking delivery of 23,100 tonnes of rubber last week. "Some are worried because if rubber contracts are defaulted, a lot of rubber will be offered freely in the market," a dealer said.
Dealers said the market is waiting for inquiries mainly from consumers in the Far East later today.
Dealers offered SMR CV at 295 cents, SMR L at 276, SMR 10 at 246, SMR 20 at 245 and latex at 192.
At noon, August RSS1 buyer rose a cent to 246.50 cents (93 U.S. cents) a kg and August SMR 20 buyer was up half a cent at 245 cents.
Malaysia-based shipping brokers quoted freight rates for rubber from Malaysia to Rotterdam at $700 per 20-ft container, and $1,400 per 40-ft container.
